messages.zh: 可恶，这些赏金猎人真是缠人！
messages.en: Damn, these bounty hunters are a nuisance!

messages.zh: 呀！虫子！！
messages.en: Ah! The bugs!

messages.zh: 好恶心！
messages.en: Disgusting!

messages.zh: 呜呃，黏黏糊糊的......
messages.en: Ugh, its gooey...

messages.zh: 快把她们包围起来！别让她们又逃了！
messages.en: Round them up! Don't let them escape again!

messages.zh: 打不过那个小个子没所谓！缠住他，然后把那个村长小姑娘抓回来！
messages.en: We don’t need to beat the little guy! Distract him and capture that village chief!

messages.zh: 可萝尔！别离开我身边！
messages.en: Carol! Don’t leave my side!
Oof--!

messages.zh: 你们两个，捂住耳朵！
messages.en: You two, cover your ears!

messages.zh: 啊？你是谁？哪冒出来的大胖子啊！
messages.en: Ah? Who the hell are you? Where did that fat guy come from!

messages.zh: 噗啊啊啊啊——！
messages.en: Ahhh--!

messages.zh: 哼，胖子？我只是壮而已。
messages.en: Huh, fatty? I'm just big.

messages.zh: 那是什么炸弹爆炸了吗？！
messages.en: What kind of bomb went off?!

messages.zh: 震撼弹而已，声音很大，没杀伤力的！不过用来驱散这些虫子还有野兽都很有效！
messages.en: Stun bomb, loud and not lethal! And it's also very effective at keeping the bugs and beasts away!

messages.zh: 趁虫子和那些家伙都被爆炸吓跑，快走！先转移到安全的地方！
messages.en: While the bugs and those guys are scared off by the explosion, move! Let’s find a safe place first!

messages.zh: 可萝尔！这次可别再是小阁楼什么的了！
messages.en: Carol! Please no attic this time!

messages.zh: 那，来这边！
messages.en: Then, this way!

messages.zh: 晴 。能见度 14公里
messages.en: Sunny \ Visibility 14 km

messages.zh: 村外树林
messages.en: Outside the village -- Forest

messages.zh: 这片树林非常偏僻，只有我和我小时候的玩伴知道这里......
messages.en: This part of the forest is very remote, only me and my childhood playmates know of this place...

messages.zh: 等下，可萝尔，先别放松。
messages.en: Wait, Carol, don't relax yet.

messages.zh: 哼。
messages.en: Hmm.

messages.zh: 锯子，弹药，爆破物。
messages.en: Chainsaw, ammunition, explosives.

messages.zh: 我把这些全放在地上了。这样可以好好谈谈宝藏了吗？
messages.en: I put them all on the floor. So can we talk about the treasure?

messages.zh: 我也是个赏金猎人，但我没有刚才那些家伙那么贪心。刚才那些充其量只是来跑腿的杂鱼，也不够聪明。
messages.en: I'm a bounty hunter too, but I'm not as greedy as those guys. Those were only just errands boys and not smart enough.

messages.zh: 比起冒着风险抢夺这位村长姑娘，不如主动与你们合作来的更有效率。
messages.en: It is more effective to cooperate with you than to take the risk of kidnapping that village chief girl from you.

messages.zh: 谢谢你刚才帮了我们，但现在不是谈宝藏的时候。
messages.en: Thank you for helping us, but this isn't the time to talk about treasure.

messages.zh: 你不是赏金猎人，不是干这行的，我看得出来。
messages.en: I can tell you're not a bounty hunter and you don’t do this line of work.

messages.zh: 而我，对这行当了如指掌。
messages.en: But me, I know it like the back of my hand

messages.zh: 滴水村周遭的赏金猎人情况，你也很清楚吗？
messages.en: Do you know the situation and the bounty hunters around droplet village?

messages.zh: 托伦团、佛罗茨团、卢布林团、瓦各斯克团——
messages.en: Toruń, Wrocław, Lublin, Gdańsk--

messages.zh: 所有的赏金猎人都在整个区域进行地毯式搜索，已经好几天了。说实话，宝藏被他们找到也只是时间问题。
messages.en: All the bounty hunters have been combing the area for days. Honestly, it's only a matter of time before they find the treasure.

messages.zh: 无论哪个赏金猎人找到宝藏，不同派系的赏金猎人绝对会为了争夺宝藏，在这片地区争得头破血流。
messages.en: No matter which bounty hunter finds the treasure first, different factions of bounty hunters will definitely fight over it in this area. And it will be a bloody fight.

messages.zh: 那时滴水村不但什么好处都拿不到，说不定还会被摧毁得一干二净，你们明白得很。
messages.en: When that time comes, not only will droplet village gain nothing, you may even be destroyed, you get the point.

messages.zh: 那么，你能为我们提供些什么？
messages.en: So, what can you offer us?

messages.zh: 野外向导，猎人经验，暗号识别，陷阱拆解，以及多一个的战力。
messages.en: Field guide, hunter experience, code recognition, trap disassembly, and one more combat power.

messages.zh: 不管哪个，都是你们现在急缺的东西。
messages.en: Either way, it’s something you really need right now.

messages.zh: 那，请问我该怎么称呼你？
messages.en: Well, what should I call you?

messages.zh: 叫我大鲍勃。
messages.en: Call me Big Bob.

messages.zh: 嗯，请你稍等，我需要和村长商量一下。
messages.en: Hmm, just a moment please. I need to talk to the village chief.

messages.zh: 这个位置，大鲍勃不会听到我们的谈话。
messages.en: Bob can’t hear us from here.

messages.zh: 我......我信不过一个赏金猎人......
messages.en: I... I can’t trust a bounty hunter.

messages.zh: 把我们骗进陷阱，或者和其他赏金猎人串通，这些都是我们没法承受的......
messages.en: We can't afford to be trapped nor fooled, he may be colluding with other bounty hunters.

messages.zh: 可萝尔，你见过这位大鲍勃吗？
messages.en: Carol, have you met this Big Bob?

messages.zh: 倒是没有......每个破坏过村庄，甚至来过的赏金猎人，他们的样子，我都记得清清楚楚......
messages.en: Not really... I remember every bounty hunter who has ever destroyed a village, or even came here.

messages.zh: 和他合作，肯定会有风险的。
messages.en: Working with him is definitely a risk.

messages.zh: 接下来的情况会随时间的推移变得更加复杂。
messages.en: The situation may become even more complicated over time.

messages.zh: 为了早点找到宝藏，我们也许必须借用他的力量。
messages.en: To find the treasure early, we may have to borrow his skills.

messages.zh: 那格拉尼，你说的那个同事也能帮上忙吗？
messages.en: Grani, can the colleague you mentioned help us?

messages.zh: 不太好说。她不是那么好相处的人，而且她同样也是个赏金猎人。
messages.en: It's hard to say. She's not that easy to get along with, and she's also a bounty hunter.

messages.zh: 如果可以的话，我想先搞清楚情况，再去找她。
messages.en: If possible, I'd like to find out more before I go to her.

messages.zh: 让我想想。
messages.en: Let me think.

messages.zh: 我不能告诉他埋藏宝藏的地方。我可以分几次告诉他大概的方向，就像在牧兽的脑袋前面挂上粮食一样。
messages.en: I can't tell him where the treasure is. I could tell him the general direction in intervals, like hanging grain in front of a herdsman's head.

messages.zh: 这样行吗？
messages.en: Is that ok?

messages.zh: 嗯，这样做是对的。
messages.en: Yeah, it's the right thing to do.

messages.zh: 我会盯紧他的。情况不对的话，我会立刻把你送出森林。
messages.en: I'll keep an eye on him. If things doesn’t look right, I'll get you out of the forest right away.

messages.zh: 可萝尔，你的安全，交给我。
messages.en: Carol, leave your safety to me.

messages.zh: 如何？先给我一个方向吧。
messages.en: How about it? Give me a direction first.

messages.zh: 我们需要一条能够迅速前往塔拉特山的道路。
messages.en: We need a fast way to mount Talat.

messages.zh: 想要前往塔拉特山，就必须穿过北方这片森林。
messages.en: To get to mount Talat, you have to go through the northern forest.

messages.zh: 那片森林，也是赏金猎人互相争夺的战场。
messages.en: That forest is also a battleground for bounty hunters.

messages.zh: 想必已经有很多赏金猎人埋伏在那里了。但是我会带你们从安全的路过去。
messages.en: There must be a lot of bounty hunters lying in wait there already. But I'll lead you to the safe path.

messages.zh: 鲍勃大叔，想要合作的话，我们是有条件的。
messages.en: Uncle Bob, we have our own proposition about the cooperation you offered.

messages.zh: 当然，这是我们接下来要谈的重点，不是吗？
messages.en: Of course, we will discuss the finer points of the deal, right?

messages.zh: 你只要先告诉我，几几分成。
messages.en: All you have to do is tell me how much you’re willing to split the treasure.

messages.zh: 我不渴！不用给我水！
messages.en: I'm not thirsty! Don't give me water!

messages.zh: 好，好，我说上尉，那两个小孩我们还找不找了？
messages.en: Okay, okay, captain, are we still looking for those two kids?

messages.zh: 怎么可能不找？我们是为了什么才走到今天的？忘了？
messages.en: Of course we’re looking for them, do you even still remember why we are here for?

messages.zh: 这边离城市远得很，通讯信号也和没有一样，虽然支援会来得晚，但是这对其他团也一样的。这可是大好的机会！
messages.en: It's a long way from the city. Communication signals are none existent, while our reinforcements will arrive late, the same goes for other groups. What a great opportunity!

messages.zh: 可那个怪物也往那个方向去了，我们......
messages.en: But that monster is also heading that way as well, we...

messages.zh: 怕什么？虽然那家伙是有点厉害，但是别忘了那边可是我们的地盘。那么多陷阱，有她好受的！
messages.en: What are you all afraid of? While that monster is a little tough, don't forget that place is our turf. There are so many traps there for her to go through!

messages.zh: 宝藏，我们要拿！怪物，我们也要狩猎！
messages.en: Treasure! It is ours! Monster, we're hunting her too!

messages.zh: 老子全都要！
messages.en: I want them all!
